Concurrent Collections

Introduction

The library provides three concurrent collection classes:

  • ConcurrentSet: provides a Set implementation backes by a ConcurrentHashMap.
  • ReadWriteList: provides a List implementation with read/write synchronization mechanism.
  • ReadWriteSet: provides a Set implementation with read/write synchronization mechanism.

ConcurrentSet

Provides a Set implementation backed by a ConcurrentHashMap. ConcurrentSet provides full concurrency for reads and adjustable expected concurrency for updates. Apart from its instanciation, this Set implementation can be used as any other Set implementation.

ReadWriteList

Provides a read/write synchronized List implementation. ReadWriteList provides full concurrency for reads and limits write operations to one thread at a time to ensure data consistency. Apart from its instanciation, this List implementation can be used as any other List implementation.

ReadWriteSet

Provides a read/write synchronized Set implementation. ReadWriteSet provides a full concurrency for reads and limits write operations to one at a time to ensure data consistency. Apart from its instanciation, this List implementation can be used as any other List implementation. This implementation has a smaller memory footprint than ConcurrentSet but does not allow multiple write operations at a time. It is recommended to use ConcurrentSet instead if memory is not a problem.
